sublink.title: Studio
sublink.secondary: We are a nomadic, non-collecting museum without a permanent collection or exhibition space. Visitors are always welcome to stop by our working studio and headquarters to learn more about the museum and past projects.

sublink.title: Calendar
sublink.secondary: We host regular openings, events, and lectures. Join our mailing list for updates.

menu.primary: The Contemporary is a nomadic, non-collecting art museum in Baltimore, MD.

sublink.title: Mission
sublink.secondary: We are committed to redefining the concept of a museum to be open, inclusive, and available to all. Our work is inspired by three guiding principles: artists matter, collaboration is key, and audience is everywhere.

sublink.title: History
sublink.secondary: Founded in 1989 as a nomadic institution, we were established in order to foster meaningful exchanges between artists, institutions, and diverse audiences. We’ve been dedicated to ‘redefining the concept of a museum’ ever since.

sublink.title: Staff
sublink.secondary: We are run by a five-person staff including a Director, Program Manager, Business Manager, Advancement Manager, and Outreach Coordinator, as well as three paid interns. Our team works collaboratively to make all operating and curatorial decisions.

sublink.title: Council
sublink.secondary: Our Curatorial Advisory Council is comprised of six national experts in the arts including curators, critics, educators, and administrators. Each member serves a 1-3 year term and advise us on our various programming initiatives.

sublink.title: Board
sublink.secondary: We are bolstered by an eighteen-person Board of Trustees. They oversee every aspect of the organization and come from various disciplines including the arts, humanities, education, medicine, law, public policy, and more.

menu.primary: The Contemporary focuses on three main program areas: Projects, Speaker Series, and Scroll.

The Contemporary offers an array of resources for artists in our area including access to Workspace, Studio Visits, Equipment Library, Art Retreat, and Grit Fund—some resources are only available to our members.

Become a Member.
The Contemporary is funded through the generosity of our Board of Trustees, as well as foundations, government agencies, corporations, partner institutions, and individuals.
